column1: This is a test that uses orange dye (fluorescein) and a blue light to detect foreign bodies in the eye.

Abnormal results may point to: - Abnormal tear production (dry eye) - Blocked tear duct - Corneal abrasion (a scratch on the surface of the cornea) - Foreign bodies, such as eyelashes or dust (eye - foreign object in) - Infection - Injury or trauma - Severe dry eye associated with arthritis (keratoconjunctivitis sicca)
